intro: Microseris procera, commonly known as the tall stonecress, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and medicinal plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. Its slender, branching stems can reach heights of up to 1 meter, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. The leaves are usually linear and arranged alternately along the stem, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
